questions.question: What is Flokicoin?
questions.answer: Flokicoin is a Layer 1 blockchain that was initially launched in 2021 following Elon Musk's tweet ("Floki has arrived").

questions.question: Who founded Flokicoin?
questions.answer: Flokicoin was originally launched by an anonymous developer, who abandoned the project shortly after its initial release at block 19,721.

questions.question: When did Flokicoin's revival take place?
questions.answer: Flokicoin was revived in 2024 at block 19,721. Instead of starting from zero, we continued from the original 2021 chain, maintaining the history integrity.

questions.question: What are Flokicoin's key features?
questions.answer:
• 1-minute block time
• Auxiliary mining support
• Halving every 210,000 blocks
• Initial block reward is 1000 $FLC per block, halving until it stabilizes at 21 $FLC
• No transaction tax
• DAO governance

questions.question: Is Flokicoin environmentally friendly since it uses Proof of Work (PoW) mining?
questions.answer: While PoW mining requires energy, Flokicoin optimizes energy use by leveraging auxiliary mining. This allows participants to mine Flokicoin alongside other chains, optimizing resource usage.

questions.question: What is $LOKI?
questions.answer:
$LOKI is the smallest unit of a Flokicoin ($FLC)

1 $FLC = 100,000,000 $LOKI

questions.question: How can I join the Flokicoin community?
questions.answer: You can join the Flokicoin community through our social media channels and chat groups. Get involved in governance decisions, participate in development discussions, and help define the fun through FEPs (Fun Enhancement Possibilities).

questions.question: How can I contribute to Flokicoin as a developer?
questions.answer: As a developer, you can contribute to Flokicoin by accessing the open-source code on our Git repositories. You can submit improvements, review code, and draft ideas through FIPs (Flokicoin Improvement Proposals) or community discussions.

sections.title: 1. Scope and Maintainers
sections.subtitle: Community-managed open-source project
sections.description: These Terms of Use are published by contributors to the Flokicoin open-source community ("Flokicoin", "we", "us"). There is currently no incorporated Flokicoin foundation or dedicated legal team. By accessing Flokicoin.org, companion apps, or community tools, you acknowledge these terms and the community-led nature of the project. If you do not agree, discontinue use immediately.

sections.title: 2. Eligibility and Local Restrictions
sections.subtitle: Check your local rules before you participate
sections.description: You must be at least 18 years old and legally permitted to use decentralized digital asset services in your jurisdiction. Certain territories may restrict participation where virtual asset activity is illegal or requires registration. You are solely responsible for understanding and complying with laws that apply to you.

sections.title: 3. Regulatory Classification
sections.subtitle: Flokicoin aligns with the 2025 treatment of decentralized virtual assets
sections.description: As of 2025, Flokicoin is treated in most jurisdictions as a decentralized virtual commodity similar to Bitcoin, not as legal tender. This status can change as regulators issue new guidance. You remain responsible for any securities, commodities, payments, consumer-protection, or tax obligations triggered by your activities. No central team monitors compliance on your behalf.

sections.title: 4. Access and Prohibited Uses
sections.subtitle: Use the network responsibly
sections.description: You agree not to use the services for unlawful, fraudulent, or harmful purposes, including sanctions evasion, money laundering, terrorist financing, market manipulation, or distribution of malicious code. We may suspend or restrict access when required by law or if your activity threatens the safety of the community.

sections.title: 5. Non-Custodial Services and Wallet Responsibility
sections.subtitle: You control your keys
sections.description: Flokicoin does not custody user assets. You are exclusively responsible for safeguarding private keys, seed phrases, and wallet credentials. Loss or compromise of your credentials may permanently prevent access to your assets. We cannot recover or re-issue private keys.

sections.title: 6. Taxes, Reporting, and Legal Obligations
sections.subtitle: Stay current with regulatory filings
sections.description: You must determine, collect, report, and remit any taxes or declarations arising from your use of Flokicoin. Virtual asset transactions may trigger income, capital gains, VAT, GST, or other obligations in your country. We do not provide tax, accounting, or legal advice.

sections.title: 7. Market Conduct and Governance
sections.subtitle: Follow fair-use rules
sections.description: When contributing to the Flokicoin ecosystem—such as submitting proposals, participating in governance, or interacting with markets—you must comply with anti-market abuse, insider trading, and fair disclosure standards applicable in your jurisdiction.

sections.title: 8. Risk Disclosure
sections.subtitle: Digital assets are volatile and can fail
sections.description: Participating in mining, holding, staking, or transacting with Flokicoin involves substantial risk, including the possible loss of all value. Prices can swing quickly, markets may lack liquidity, bridges and third-party services can fail, and protocol bugs or attacks may disrupt the network. Engage only if you fully understand these risks.

sections.title: 9. Regulatory Awareness
sections.subtitle: Stay informed about jurisdiction-specific rules
sections.description: Regulators across the EU (MiCA), United States, United Kingdom, Asia-Pacific, Middle East, Africa, and Latin America continue to refine virtual asset regimes. Because Flokicoin has no central compliance office, you must track local licensing, reporting, or consumer-protection requirements that apply to your activities.

sections.title: 10. Financial Crime Controls
sections.subtitle: Adopt your own AML and KYC safeguards
sections.description: Flokicoin does not onboard customers or run custodial services, but ecosystem contributors are expected to apply proportionate anti-money laundering, counter-terrorist financing, and sanctions screening practices when relevant. If you build products on Flokicoin, implement due diligence, record retention, and suspicious activity reporting obligations appropriate to your jurisdiction.

sections.title: 11. Security Practices and Responsible Disclosure
sections.subtitle: Protect your keys and report issues responsibly
sections.description: Secure your wallets with hardware devices, verify URLs, and stay alert for phishing. The community follows peer review, audits, and monitoring best practices, yet no control eliminates risk. Report suspected vulnerabilities to security@flokicoin.org so volunteers can coordinate fixes before public disclosure.

sections.title: 12. Updates and Contact
sections.subtitle: Community-governed changes
sections.description: These terms may change as the community adapts to new regulations or technical developments. Updates will be posted with a revised effective date, and continued use signifies acceptance. For general questions, reach out via contact@flokicoin.org or the official Discord—responses are handled by volunteers.

sections.title: 1. On-chain Transparency
sections.subtitle: Public blockchain activity is outside our control
sections.description: Transactions, wallet addresses, and smart contract interactions recorded on-chain are public and immutable. We cannot alter, delete, or control how third parties access that information.

sections.title: 2. Cookies and Analytics
sections.subtitle: How we use Google Analytics and similar tools
sections.description: We use functional cookies and Google Analytics to understand aggregate site usage, detect errors, and improve performance. Where required, we request consent before setting non-essential cookies. You can manage or revoke consent through your browser settings or the cookie preference banner, and we do not attempt to combine analytics data with personally identifiable information.

sections.title: 3. How We Use Data
sections.subtitle: Operating, improving, and securing our services
sections.description: Collected data helps us deliver content, monitor platform health, detect abuse, communicate updates, and comply with legal obligations. We do not sell personal data.

sections.title: 4. International Transfers
sections.subtitle: Global infrastructure means cross-border processing
sections.description: We may store and process information in the European Union, United States, or other countries where we or our service providers operate. When required by law, we implement safeguards such as Standard Contractual Clauses.

sections.title: 5. Data Retention
sections.subtitle: How long we keep information
sections.description: We retain analytics and support records only as long as needed for the purposes described or to meet regulatory requirements. Aggregated or anonymized data may be kept longer for research and security.

sections.title: 6. Security Measures
sections.subtitle: Protecting the data we hold
sections.description: We apply administrative, organizational, and technical safeguards such as access controls, encryption in transit, and vulnerability monitoring. No internet service is completely secure, so exercise caution when sharing information.

sections.title: 7. Your Rights
sections.subtitle: Control over your personal information
sections.description: Subject to local laws, you may request access, correction, deletion, portability, or restriction of your off-chain personal data. Send requests to contact@flokicoin.org with proof of identity. On-chain data cannot be modified, and responses are provided on a best-effort basis by community volunteers.

sections.title: 8. Contact and Complaints
sections.subtitle: How to reach us or regulators
sections.description: If you have privacy questions, email contact@flokicoin.org or join the official Discord. There is no dedicated legal team, so please allow time for a volunteer response. You may also lodge a complaint with your local data protection authority if you believe our handling of your data violates applicable law.

sections.title: 9. Updates
sections.subtitle: Staying current with privacy requirements
sections.description: We review this Privacy Policy periodically to reflect new legal guidance, service updates, and community feedback. Material changes will be announced on this page with a revised effective date.

sections.title: 10. Information We Collect
sections.subtitle: What data we receive and our purposes
sections.description: We collect minimal off-chain data, such as IP address, browser type, device information, referring URLs, and usage metrics needed to operate and secure Flokicoin.org, community portals, and developer tools.
